duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide urgent assessment/intake services and maintain a panel of patients receiving ongoing care in a Community Behavioral Health Center.
Consult, assess, and intervene with high-risk patients and their families regarding emotional and social problems.
Conduct outpatient individual therapy and psychosocial assessments, make psychosocial diagnoses, and plan effective treatments.
Collaborate with healthcare team members, social, governmental, and legal agencies, and other sources in the overall care of the patient.
Provide clinical supervision to other department personnel and comply with documentation and data collection requirements.
Maintain competency in areas of responsibility, attend scheduled staff meetings, and obtain continuing education units necessary to maintain licensure.
Support graduate and undergraduate training programs by supervising students, identify weaknesses in operation, and recommend improvements.
Represent the department throughout the hospital and outside community regarding social work practice and field.

Maintain patient confidentiality according to hospital policy, practice professional discretion, and document each patient encounter in the medical record or the Department clinical record concurrently.
Maintain work area and equipment in a neat and orderly manner, assist in the cleaning and organizing of department, and maintain a complete understanding of emergency procedures.
Conform to hospital standards of conduct, including those pertaining to patient rights and notify supervisor when patients in age group not regularly served are present.
Perform other duties as needed and follow established hospital infection control and safety procedures.
Maintain knowledge of community resources and agencies that serve the children and families, possess advanced interpersonal skills, and be comfortable in a fast-paced environment.
Work in an interdisciplinary team, demonstrate cultural sensitivity and a sense of humor, and have computer literacy with the ability to use standard word processing, spreadsheet programs, and email.

education_certification.credential: Master's Degree in Social Work, Counseling, Clinical Psychology, or related field from an accredited school.
Massachusetts mental health counselor license or licensed independent clinical social work license or eligible status.
One to two years of on-the-job training to acquire knowledge of Social Work process and community resources in relation to health, illness, and disability.
Strong communication skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks and responsibilities effectively.
Bilingual or multi-lingual skills preferred, especially Spanish, Portuguese Creole, or Haitian Creole.
Knowledge of software applications such as Microsoft Excel and Word.
